title: Houston streets that are prone to flooding, high water
text:

Houstonians, brace for another rainy commute Monday. Continue clicking to make sure you're drive in town doesn't include these high-water streets. Houston streets that are the most likely to flood
Houstonians, brace for another rainy commute Monday. Continue clicking to make sure you're drive in town doesn't include these high-water streets. Photo: Melissa Phillip, Staff Image 2 of 32 Worst Houston high water spots for road flooding
You don't get to live in a place called the Bayou City and not get a little road flooding from time to time (or to be more specific, EVERY TIME IT RAINS!).
These are some of the worst spots in Houston for high water and flooded roadways. less Worst Houston high water spots for road flooding

About 150 flooding incidents were reported on Houston streets between January-March 2015. Photo: Google Maps Image 32 of 32 Houston streets that are prone to flooding, high water 1 / 32 Back to Gallery Another day in Houston, another chance of flooding.
This seems to be the recent theme of weather forecasts in the Houston area. Less than a week ago, Houston and its greater neighborhoods were swept with the Valentine's Day storms and now, locals are facing another storm that could bring floods.
V-DAY DESTRUCTION: Where the Valentine's Day tornadoes hit the Houston area
If you've lived here long enough, you know that there are certain areas of Houston that just aren't a smart idea to try and drive through (we're talking to you U.S. 59 and Allen Parkway), but if you're new here, navigating through the flooded streets can prove to not only be inconvenient, but also dangerous.
As much as seven inches of rain in a 24 hour period left Houston rain-soaked and flooded Jan. 18, 2017. Hardest hit areas included Meyerland, the Heights and Highway 288.
Media: manual_upload If you are having to travel in flood weather, then click through the gallery above to make sure your route doesn't include one of the worst high-water streets in Houston.
